review: I've bought 2 of these stupid things. Both times they work great for like 3 months and then one day, for no apparent reason, they decide to just stop connecting to my network even though it says the strength is "very good" and even though my wi-fi is working fine with my other devices. Nothing fixes the problem. Not restarting. Not unplugging and restarting. Not even resetting back to factory settings. Nothing. The first time it was after a powerful thunderstorm and I thought maybe it was related to lightening. So I sucked it up and bought a new one. This time it just quit. For no reason. After only 3-4 months of daily use. Grrrrr

review: Easy to operate, works well and is reliable. I would recommend your TV have 2 HDMI slots if you are also using one for your cable t.v., otherwise you will have to rotate between the two. I especially liked having Amazon Prime Music access in addition to my Netflix and Pandora accounts.  I prefer Amazon Prime Music to Pandora.  Used it on a t.v. at a vacation rental home. You will need the WiFi password to connect it, as well as your other subscription passwords. I plan to use it on a home t.v. as well.  I also have a Roku.  Fire stick with remote was half the price for essentially the same functionality, as far as my needs go.
